hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: France: No Haven

abstract.p: France will not open second refugee center near English Channel, and will work with Britain to tighten security at railroad and road terminal; France will also tighten sanctions against Afghan, Kurdish and other migrants trying to get into Britain illegally; British immigration authorities will go to French side to dissuade people at Red Cross center (S)

block.p: The government said it would not open a second refugee center near the English Channel and work with Britain to dissuade the rush of asylum-seekers trying to sneak into Britain through the Channel Tunnel. The interior ministers of both countries announced that they would tighten security at the tunnel's railroad and road terminal and France would toughen sanctions against the many Afghan, Kurdish and other would-be immigrants who try to get into Britain as stowaways on trains and trucks. British immigration officials plan to move to the French side to dissuade the hundreds of people gathered at a Red Cross refugee center, waiting to for a chance to cross.
